Module Basics
Package basics.math.rot

Class RotationQuaternion

java.lang.Object
basics.math.rot.RotationQuaternion
public class RotationQuaternion
extends java.lang.Object
Representation of a rotation based on quaternions.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    RotationQuaternion​(double[] quaternion)
    Create a rotation by the actual quaternion, i.e. w+x·i+y·j+z·k.
    RotationQuaternion​(double[][] rotationMatrix)
    Create a quaternion rotation by 3x3 rotation matrix.
    RotationQuaternion​(double theta, double rotx, double roty, double rotz)
    Create a rotation by rotation angle and axis.
    RotationQuaternion​(RotationQuaternion rot1, RotationQuaternion rot2)
    Create a result rotation as a construction of first applying rot1, then rot2.
    RotationQuaternion​(RotationQuaternion rot1, RotationQuaternion rot2, RotationQuaternion rot3)
    Create a result rotation as a construction of first applying rot1, then rot2, then rot3.

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Create a null rotation object.

    Create a rotation around the x-axis.

    Create a rotation around the y-axis.

    Create a rotation around the z-axis.

    Get the rotation angles for each axis, the so-called Euler angles.

    Get the rotation angles for each axis, the so-called Euler angles.
    static double[] hamiltonProduct​(double a1, double b1, double c1, double d1, double a2, double b2, double c2, double d2)
    Computes the Hamilton product of quaternion (a1+b1·i+c1·j+d1·k) and (a2+b2·i+c2·j+d2·k).
    static double[] hamiltonProductIJK​(double a1, double b1, double c1, double d1, double a2, double b2, double c2, double d2)
    Computes the Hamilton produce of quaternion (a1+b1·i+c1·j+d1·k) and (a2+b2·i+c2·j+d2·k).
    RotationQuaternion inverse()
    Get the inverse rotation.

  • Constructor Details

    • RotationQuaternion

      public RotationQuaternion​(double theta, double rotx, double roty, double rotz)
      Create a rotation by rotation angle and axis. The axis vector is internally normalized to a unit vector.
      Parameters:
      theta - rotation angle
      rotx - rotation axis x
      roty - rotation axis y
      rotz - rotation axis z

    • RotationQuaternion

      public RotationQuaternion​(double[] quaternion)
      Create a rotation by the actual quaternion, i.e. w+x·i+y·j+z·k.
      Parameters:
      quaternion - array of 4 with w, x, y, z

    • RotationQuaternion

      public RotationQuaternion​(RotationQuaternion rot1, RotationQuaternion rot2)
      Create a result rotation as a construction of first applying rot1, then rot2.
      Parameters:
      rot1 - firstrotation
      rot2 - second rotation

    • RotationQuaternion

      public RotationQuaternion​(RotationQuaternion rot1, RotationQuaternion rot2, RotationQuaternion rot3)
      Create a result rotation as a construction of first applying rot1, then rot2, then rot3.
      Parameters:
      rot1 - firstrotation
      rot2 - second rotation
      rot3 - last rotation

    • RotationQuaternion

      public RotationQuaternion​(double[][] rotationMatrix)
      Create a quaternion rotation by 3x3 rotation matrix. The underlying approach is based on Accurate Computation of Quaternions from Rotation Matrices, Soheil Sarabandi and Federico Thomas.
      Parameters:
      rotationMatrix - rotation matrix

  • Method Details

    • quaternion

      public double[] quaternion()
      Return the actual quaternion, i.e. w+x·i+y·j+z·k.
      Returns:
      array of 4 with w, x, y, z

    • rotationAngleAndAxis

      public double[] rotationAngleAndAxis()
      Return the rotation angle and axis unit vector that forms the basis for this rotation.
      Returns:
      array of 4 with theta, x, y, z

    • eulerAngles

      public double[] eulerAngles()
      Get the rotation angles for each axis, the so-called Euler angles. The rotation is applied in the ordering x-y-plane – x-z-plane – y-z-plane.
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane,

    • eulerAnglesReverse

      public double[] eulerAnglesReverse()
      Get the rotation angles for each axis, the so-called Euler angles. The rotation is applied in reverse order (compared to eulerAngles()), i.e. the rotation is applied in the ordering y-z-plane – x-z-plane – x-y-plane.
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane,

    • createNullrotation

      public static RotationQuaternion createNullrotation()
      Create a null rotation object.
      Returns:
      rotation with no effect

    • createXrotation

      public static RotationQuaternion createXrotation​(double alpha)
      Create a rotation around the x-axis. Positive angle means turning from y to z.
      Parameters:
      alpha - rotation angle
      Returns:
      rotation

    • createYrotation

      public static RotationQuaternion createYrotation​(double alpha)
      Create a rotation around the y-axis. Positive angle means turning from x to z.
      Parameters:
      alpha - rotation angle
      Returns:
      rotation

    • createZrotation

      public static RotationQuaternion createZrotation​(double alpha)
      Create a rotation around the z-axis. Positive angle means turning from x to y.
      Parameters:
      alpha - rotation angle
      Returns:
      rotation

    • rotate

      public double[] rotate​(double x, double y, double z)
      Rotate a point.
      Parameters:
      x - point x
      y - point y
      z - point z
      Returns:
      rotated point as array of 3 with x, y, z

    • rotateInverse

      public double[] rotateInverse​(double x, double y, double z)
      Rotate a point by inverse rotation.
      Parameters:
      x - point x
      y - point y
      z - point z
      Returns:
      rotated point as array of 3 with x, y, z

    • rotate

      public double[] rotate​(double[] p)
      Rotate a point.
      Parameters:
      p - point as array of 3 with x, y, z
      Returns:
      rotated point as array of 3 with x, y, z

    • rotateInverse

      public double[] rotateInverse​(double[] p)
      Rotate a point by inverse rotation.
      Parameters:
      p - point as array of 3 with x, y, z
      Returns:
      rotated point as array of 3 with x, y, z

    • rotationMatrix

      public double[][] rotationMatrix()
      Compute a rotation matrix from a rotation.
      Returns:
      3x3 rotation matrix

    • inverse

      public RotationQuaternion inverse()
      Get the inverse rotation.
      Returns:
      inverse

    • hamiltonProduct

      public static double[] hamiltonProduct​(double a1, double b1, double c1, double d1, double a2, double b2, double c2, double d2)
      Computes the Hamilton product of quaternion (a1+b1·i+c1·j+d1·k) and (a2+b2·i+c2·j+d2·k).
      Parameters:
      a1 - a1
      b1 - b1
      c1 - c1
      d1 - d1
      a2 - a2
      b2 - b2
      c2 - c2
      d2 - d2
      Returns:
      product quaternion

    • hamiltonProductIJK

      public static double[] hamiltonProductIJK​(double a1, double b1, double c1, double d1, double a2, double b2, double c2, double d2)
      Computes the Hamilton produce of quaternion (a1+b1·i+c1·j+d1·k) and (a2+b2·i+c2·j+d2·k). Only the components of i, j, k are computed
      Parameters:
      a1 - a1
      b1 - b1
      c1 - c1
      d1 - d1
      a2 - a2
      b2 - b2
      c2 - c2
      d2 - d2
      Returns:
      product quaternion, but only the compents of i, j, k
